intro: Oreogrammitis antipodalis, commonly known as the Antarctic haircap, is a moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and lanceolate leaves that are often recurved. The plant forms dense mats and thrives in cold, moist environments, particularly in the Southern Hemisphere. Its spore capsules are inclined and often covered with a protective operculum. Oreogrammitis antipodalis plays a vital role in stabilizing soil and maintaining ecological balance in its harsh habitats.
